page.title: 01Marshes North of Upchurch
page.content: The area to the north and east of Upduch comprises a flat peninsular and @art of the Medway estuary. This part of the estuary is predominatly mudflats at low tide, vegetated salt-marshes and some creaks hat are navigable by small craft. The peninsular includes Ham Green where there is a small dock/marina for approx. twelve craft, and Wetham Green. A narrow hedged lane called Poot Lane links with Upchurch Village. The west side is marshland used for grazing and the east side supports wheat crops, soft fruit and some apple orchards and a few sheep. Recently the emphasis has changed from hard fruit to grain as a result of EEC policy. There are approx 2 dozen houses a little light rural industry and a few inhabeted barges moored to the shoreline. The peninsular is
